Context:
Program Name: Business Administration – Project Management
Code: B126
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,640.00
International Tuition: $17,455.00
Location: St. James Campus
Method of Study: Full-time
Program Description: Prepare to manage project scope and change, project control, project staffing and risk management, provide motivation and goal-setting, utilize project management tools in careers that incorporate project management or stand-alone project manager positions.
Program Outcomes: Demonstrate knowledge, skills, and abilities related to business in general and project management in particular.
Delivery Mode: On Campus (Semester 1-6 for both fall and winter)

Context:
The George Brown College Centre for Business offers various educational programs in business, leading to diplomas, advanced diplomas, and degrees. These programs are accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP). Students enrolled in this program are required to bring their own laptops due to a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiative.

The Center for Business programs focus on project management, enabling students to analyze the impact of project management initiatives on various aspects of an organization and implement project plans. They also learn accounting and financial knowledge application, allocate human resources, work effectively with teams and stakeholders, and demonstrate leadership skills. The College has 14 accredited programs in Accounting & Finance, HR, Management, and Marketing, making it one of only two colleges in Ontario with ACBSP accreditation.

The students can gain real-life experience through field education opportunities, which may include on-the-job work experience and projects with real-world challenges and clients. Career options for graduates may include positions such as assistant project manager, junior project manager/coordinator, and project manager.

For more information about the program or field education, contact the Centre for Business at business@georgebrown.ca.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business Administration – Project Management Program B126 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
George Brown College is a Global Registered Education Provider with the Project Management Institute (PMI). Graduates of any George Brown College courses listed on PMI's Registered Education Provider portal can satisfy the education requirements necessary to apply for the Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.

The B126 program requires students to complete 36 courses: 30 Mandatory courses, 3 Business Electives, and 3 General Education Electives. Depending on the results of placement tests, students may need to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) or MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation) before progressing to other courses. These courses do not count toward the 36 courses required for graduation and will be charged extra.

Students must complete three General Education courses from at least two of the following categories: Social Sciences, Arts and Humanities, or Science and Technology. Students are required to make up any failed or dropped courses before they are eligible to graduate and can do so during the day or through Continuing Education. Not all courses may be offered in every semester, and students should check with the business office staff for equivalency and special timetable requirements.

Required Courses for Semester 1:
- BUS 1038: Business Concepts I (No prerequisite)
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts (No prerequisite)
- COMP 1010: Business Computer Applications I (None)

Context:
Program Offered: Business Administration with a focus on Project Management and Human Resources

Business Electives (semesters 5 and 6):
- CMMK 1114: Business Research & Report Writing
- COMM 1034: Communications course (appears twice)
- COMP 1113: Principles of E-Business
- BUS 1067: Field Education
- MGMT 2037: Retail Management
- MARK 2049: Marketing course
- MGMT 2036: Customer Service
- HRM 2027: Coaching for Effective Performance Management
- BUS 3015: Applied Business Planning
- HRM 2030: Field Based Advanced Coaching (by interview only)
- MGMT 3015: Quality Improvement through Lean/Six Sigma

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Evaluate the impact of global issues on an organization's business opportunities
- Apply principles of corporate sustainability, corporate social responsibility and ethics
- Assess and use current concepts/systems and technologies
- Conduct and present research
- Plan, implement and evaluate projects
- Perform work in compliance with relevant statutes, regulations and business practices
- Apply human resource practices
- Use accounting and financial principles
- Assess marketing and sales concepts and strategies
- Outline principles of supply chain management and operations management
- Participate in the development of a business plan
- Develop strategies for ongoing personal and professional development
- Outline strategies used to manage risks

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,640.00
- International Tuition: $17,455.00

Context: The School of Management at George Brown College is located mainly at 200 King St. E. and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Campus tours are offered regularly, and virtual tours are available online. The following programs were mentioned: Project Management (Postgraduate) (B415), Business Administration – Project Management (with work experience) (B156), and International Business Management (Postgraduate) (B411). Interested individuals can book campus tours, info sessions, or sign up to receive tailored resources for their application process. The application form requires the applicant's first name, last name, email address, domestic or international status, and country of origin. They must also agree to receive email communications from George Brown College.
